title: 10 Stylish Pieces to Wear Under a Cardigan Sweater

steps.title: If it’s warm out, don’t add too much bulk underneath your cardigan.
steps.content: If it’s warm out, don’t add too much bulk underneath your cardigan. Throw on a form-fitting tank top, then cover your arms up with a thin, long cardigan. [1] X Expert Source Dina Scherer Wardrobe Stylist & Personal Shopper Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Tank tops look great with thinner cardigans because there’s no extra fabric on your arms or your shoulders. Plus, if you get too hot, you can just take the cardigan off! [2] X Research source Pair your outfit with jean shorts and sandals if it’s really warm, or try a pair of skinny jeans and sneakers if it’s only slightly warm. Add a statement necklace to draw attention to your upper body, and finish off your look with a large, structured handbag.

steps.title: This is a classic way to style a cardigan for a casual occasion.
steps.content: This is a classic way to style a cardigan for a casual occasion. [3] X Expert Source Dina Scherer Wardrobe Stylist & Personal Shopper Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. If you’re grabbing lunch with a friend or running errands, put on a fitted T-shirt and add a thin cardigan on top. The fitted nature of the T-shirt won’t add any extra bulk under your cardigan, so you can wear a waist-length or knee-length one without any worries. Pair your look with skinny jeans or cigarette pants to look put-together and stylish. [4] X Research source To wear this outfit to the office, try tucking your shirt into a pair of dress pants. Pair your outfit with sneakers to keep it casual or ballet flats to get a bit more dressy.

steps.title: Match the bulk of an oversized cardigan with an oversized T-shirt.
steps.content: Match the bulk of an oversized cardigan with an oversized T-shirt. If you’re rocking a larger, more fluffy cardigan, put on a T-shirt that’s just slightly too big for you. Tuck the excess fabric into your waistband, or tie it into a knot on the front of your shirt. Finish off your outfit with a pair of straight-legged jeans to match the bulk on the top half of your body. [5] X Research source For a more modern take on this look, try wearing a band or graphic T-shirt. Pair this look with some chunky bracelets and a small backpack for all your essentials. Keep things casual with a pair of sneakers or some lace-up booties.

steps.title: Show some skin in a long, bulky cardigan.
steps.content: Show some skin in a long, bulky cardigan. If you’re worried about the length of your cardigan overwhelming your silhouette, balance it out by showing off some skin. Pick out a V-neck shirt to expose your collar bone and draw attention to your upper body. [6] X Expert Source Dina Scherer Wardrobe Stylist & Personal Shopper Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Add a thin chain necklace and some dangly earrings to draw the eyes upwards and make you look taller. [7] X Research source If you’re wearing a long cardigan, pair it with skinny jeans to maintain a long, thin silhouette. If you have a bulkier cardigan on, you can try wearing straight-leg or boot-cut pants.

steps.title: A long cable knit cardigan pairs well with a satin blouse.
steps.content: A long cable knit cardigan pairs well with a satin blouse. Throw on a flowy blouse that hits around your waistline, then pair it with a chunky, long cardigan. Add a pair of skinny jeans or leggings to contrast with the bulk of fabric on your upper body, and throw on a pair of stud earrings to keep things classy and elegant. [8] X Research source To dress this look up, wear a pair of over-the-knee boots. To keep it more casual, try sandals or loafers.

steps.title: Take your cardigan to the office with this business casual look.
steps.content: Take your cardigan to the office with this business casual look. Put on a button-down shirt, then add a cardigan on top. To make it more professional-looking, pick a cardigan that buttons in the front so you can button it up at the office. Pair your outfit with slacks and dress shoes or heels to look appropriate at the office. [9] X Research source If your button-down has a pattern on it, pick out a solid-colored cardigan so they don’t clash. To look even more professional, wear a tie underneath your cardigan.

steps.title: Stay warm in the winter with multiple cozy layers.
steps.content: Stay warm in the winter with multiple cozy layers. Put on a bright-colored flannel, like red, blue, or green. Pair it with a neutral-colored cardigan to look classy yet casual while you stay warm. Add a pair of dark wash jeans or a denim skirt to complete your look. [10] X Research source This outfit goes well with boots or high-heeled booties. You can also add a scarf or a beanie to accessorize.

steps.title: A thin turtleneck adds just the right amount of fabric.
steps.content: A thin turtleneck adds just the right amount of fabric. Throw on a turtleneck sweater, then add a cardigan on top (it can be thin or bulky—either style looks good with this outfit). Pair your look with a mini skirt and tights to show off your legs, or keep things casual with a pair of skinny jeans. [11] X Research source Try to pick out a form-fitting turtleneck so you don’t overwhelm yourself with fabric. This outfit pairs well with boots and a long trench coat.

steps.title: This fashion-forward outfit works well with large, oversized cardigans.
steps.content: This fashion-forward outfit works well with large, oversized cardigans. Throw on a thin zip-up jacket or hoodie, then zip it up all the way. Throw on your oversized cardigan and pair your outfit with skinny jeans or leggings. Top off your look with a pair of sneakers or heeled booties, depending on where you’re going that day. [12] X Research source Bomber jackets also look great underneath oversized cardigans. Accessorize with simple earrings and a few chain necklaces.

steps.title: If your cardigan is solid-colored, use your under layer as a statement.
steps.content: If your cardigan is solid-colored, use your under layer as a statement. Go for florals, stripes, and polka dots to draw attention to your outfit and really make yourself stand out. You could also try animal print or paisley under a neutral-colored cardigan. [13] X Research source If you’re taking your cardigan to the office, stick to small prints that aren’t overbearing. They’ll look more professional that way.
